Package frogger.actor

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
frogger.actor.Actor
frogger.actor.Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Animal
extends Actor
The Animal class provides a playable character that can handle key inputs from the user. The Animal instance will interact with other nodes that it's bounds intersect with. The Animal instance also keeps track of level progress(how many end goals reached) and the current score.

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      public Animal​(double waterBoundary)
      Creates an Animal while loading all required images(still and jumping frog along with all images required for death animations) and sets onKeyPressed and onKeyReleased EventHandlers.
      Parameters:
      waterBoundary - y-coordinate of where the water region begins in the Level this instance is a child of.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act​(long now)
      Calls outOfBoundsCheck() and collisionCheck() and plays a death animation, if any. Called every frame.
      Specified by:
      act in class Actor
      Parameters:
      now - Time in nanoseconds. Passed as argument from AnimationTimer.handle().

    • handleMovement

      private void handleMovement​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Moves instance corresponding to key pressed and plays jump animation. EventHandlers called for KeyPressed and KeyReleased events.
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent that is fired.

    • outOfBoundsCheck

      private void outOfBoundsCheck()
      Checks whether instance has left application window bounds and resets position if so.

    • collisionCheck

      private void collisionCheck()
      Checks whether this instance's bounds intersect with other Actor objects and handles it if so. If intersecting with an Obstacle instance, deathType is set to DeathType.CAR. If intersecting with a Platform instance, move the Animal instance at the same speed as the Plaform instance. If intersected Platform is a SinkingPlatform and isSunk(), deathType is set to DeathType.WATER. Checking for whether this instance has reached one of the end goals is done here.

    • initialise

      public void initialise()
      Initialises the default values for the instance. Resets points to 0. Resets end goals reached to 0. Reset furthest y-position reached to application window y-coordinate upper bound. Calls reset()

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the state and position of the instance. Resets animation counters. Resets deathType to DeathType.NONE. Resets x and y positions. Resets image displayed to a still Frogger image. Sets rotate to 0.

    • setEndsFilled

      public void setEndsFilled​(int endsFilled)
      Sets the number of endsFilled to a specified number and fires a PropertyChangeEvent to Listeners.
      Parameters:
      endsFilled - The new number of end goals reached.

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Get the current score.
      Returns:
      The current points value.

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints​(int points)
      Sets the current score to a specified value and fires a PropertyChangeEvent to Listeners.
      Parameters:
      points - The new score value.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener​(java.lang.String propertyName, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a Listener to a list of PropertyChangeListeners.
      Parameters:
      propertyName - A String object representing the name of the property that the Listener is listening to.
      listener - The Listener object.

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener​(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a Listener from the list of PropertyChangeListeners.
      Parameters:
      listener - The Listener object.
